column1: (a)  Did his Lordship of the High Court err in law in failing to recognize that the learned
President of the Labour Tribunal had failed to evaluate the evidence of the Petitioner
(c)  Did his Lordship of the High Court err in law in failing to recognise that the learned
President of the Labour Tribunal has erred in law in failing to duly appreciate and
apply the law relating to admissibility of confessions in Labour Tribunals?
(d) Did his Lordship of the High Court err in law in failing to properly ascertain and
apply the principles of law pertaining to reinstatement, especially where a loss of
confidence reposed in the Applicant has been occasioned?
(g) Did his Lordship of the High Court err in law in failing to recognize that the learned
President of the Labour Tribunal has erred in law in failing to duly appreciate that
the Applicant did not adduce proof of actual losses or of any attempt to mitigate his
losses, and was thus not entitled to compensation/backwages?
(h) Did his Lordship of the High Court err in law in failing to recognize that the learned
President of the Labour Tribunal has erred in law in applying the principles of law
